dst_node: Mountain Trail (cleft to northwest, down southwest, down east)
prefix_walkthrough:
!!! Here is a walkthrough of a text game:

==>STEP NUM: 0
==>ACT: Init
==>OBSERVATION: A Galactic servant, that's what you feel like at the moment.  You'd think that the Timelords would be pleased that you were not only responsible for discovering that Morbius' brain had been secretly kept alive, but that you were instrumental in destroying the revived villian.  Do they offer you their gratitude?  No, they merely point out that you left the Brain of Morbius on Karn and demand that you retrieve it and bring it back to Gallifrey.  That's gratitude for you.

However, as you value your own freedom, you really don't have much choice but to do as the Timelords request.  At least they gave you the coordinates for Karn, but you did notice that they refused to give you return coordinates for Gallifrey, saying you'd receive them once you'd procured the brain.  So much for Gallifreyan hospitality...

Your thoughts are interrupted as you hear a familiar thud.  The TARDIS has landed on Karn.

Return to Karn
by Patrick Wigfull
Based on the television programme "Doctor Who"
  Type "help" for general instructions.
  Type "background" for information about the "The Brain of Morbius".
  Type "about" for information about this program.

Release 2 / Serial number 961207 / Inform v6.05 Library 6/2
Standard interpreter 1.0

Console Room
The console room is the heart of operations of the TARDIS. Dominating the room is a six-side console.  Located above the console is the scanner.  A corridor to the east leads further into the TARDIS.  On the west side of the room are the main doors.

What do you want to do, Doctor


==>STEP NUM: 1
==>ACT: inventory
==>OBSERVATION: You are carrying:
  a tweed jacket (being worn)
  a floppy felt hat (being worn)
  an incredibly long scarf (being worn)
  your yo-yo
  the TARDIS key


==>STEP NUM: 2
==>ACT: remove jacket
==>OBSERVATION: You take off the tweed jacket.


==>STEP NUM: 3
==>ACT: drop jacket
==>OBSERVATION: Dropped.


==>STEP NUM: 4
==>ACT: drop yo-yo
==>OBSERVATION: Dropped.


==>STEP NUM: 5
==>ACT: drop key
==>OBSERVATION: Dropped.


==>STEP NUM: 6
==>ACT: east
==>OBSERVATION: Corridor
This corridor, like almost all the corridors of the TARDIS, seems to stretch on forever.  The console room lies to the west, and the corridor continues eastward into the distance.  There's a closed door on the south wall.


==>STEP NUM: 7
==>ACT: open door
==>OBSERVATION: You open the door.


==>STEP NUM: 8
==>ACT: south
==>OBSERVATION: Workshop
This is the room where you do much of your tinkering with electronic gadgetry.  Many a Rutan invasion or Dalek plot has been foiled by an ingenius invention you've thrown together at last minute in this room.  In fitting with your work habits, it's usually a rather untidy place.  However, in your latest fit of spring cleaning you've almost emptied the place out. There's a small cupboard on the eastern wall, and on the north wall an open door connects the workshop to the corridor outside.

Your workbench dominates the center of the room.

On the workbench is your toolkit (which is closed).


==>STEP NUM: 9
==>ACT: get toolkit
==>OBSERVATION: Taken.


==>STEP NUM: 10
==>ACT: open toolkit
==>OBSERVATION: Opening the toolkit reveals your sonic screwdriver and a homing device.


==>STEP NUM: 11
==>ACT: get screwdriver
==>OBSERVATION: Taken.


==>STEP NUM: 12
==>ACT: get homing
==>OBSERVATION: Taken.


==>STEP NUM: 13
==>ACT: examine homing
==>OBSERVATION: The homing device is a small gold polyhedron.  It is currently turned off.


==>STEP NUM: 14
==>ACT: turn on homing
==>OBSERVATION: When you switch on the homing device, a pulsating glow appears somewhere inside it.


==>STEP NUM: 15
==>ACT: open cupboard
==>OBSERVATION: Opening the cupboard reveals a small cloth pouch (which is closed).


==>STEP NUM: 16
==>ACT: get pouch
==>OBSERVATION: Taken.


==>STEP NUM: 17
==>ACT: open pouch
==>OBSERVATION: Opening the small cloth pouch reveals a gold card.


==>STEP NUM: 18
==>ACT: put pouch in toolkit
==>OBSERVATION: You put the small cloth pouch into the toolkit.


==>STEP NUM: 19
==>ACT: north
==>OBSERVATION: Corridor


==>STEP NUM: 20
==>ACT: west
==>OBSERVATION: Console Room

You can see the TARDIS key, your yo-yo and a tweed jacket here.


==>STEP NUM: 21
==>ACT: examine scanner
==>OBSERVATION: The scanner (which resembles an old television set) displays a picture of a barren rocky landscape.

raw_response_step_navi:
!!! Here is a walkthrough of a text game:

==>STEP NUM: 0
==>ACT: Init
==>OBSERVATION: A Galactic servant, that's what you feel like at the moment.  You'd think that the Timelords would be pleased that you were not only responsible for discovering that Morbius' brain had been secretly kept alive, but that you were instrumental in destroying the revived villian.  Do they offer you their gratitude?  No, they merely point out that you left the Brain of Morbius on Karn and demand that you retrieve it and bring it back to Gallifrey.  That's gratitude for you.

However, as you value your own freedom, you really don't have much choice but to do as the Timelords request.  At least they gave you the coordinates for Karn, but you did notice that they refused to give you return coordinates for Gallifrey, saying you'd receive them once you'd procured the brain.  So much for Gallifreyan hospitality...

Your thoughts are interrupted as you hear a familiar thud.  The TARDIS has landed on Karn.

Return to Karn
by Patrick Wigfull
Based on the television programme "Doctor Who"
  Type "help" for general instructions.
  Type "background" for information about the "The Brain of Morbius".
  Type "about" for information about this program.

Release 2 / Serial number 961207 / Inform v6.05 Library 6/2
Standard interpreter 1.0

Console Room
The console room is the heart of operations of the TARDIS. Dominating the room is a six-side console.  Located above the console is the scanner.  A corridor to the east leads further into the TARDIS.  On the west side of the room are the main doors.

What do you want to do, Doctor


==>STEP NUM: 1
==>ACT: inventory
==>OBSERVATION: You are carrying:
  a tweed jacket (being worn)
  a floppy felt hat (being worn)
  an incredibly long scarf (being worn)
  your yo-yo
  the TARDIS key


==>STEP NUM: 2
==>ACT: remove jacket
==>OBSERVATION: You take off the tweed jacket.


==>STEP NUM: 3
==>ACT: drop jacket
==>OBSERVATION: Dropped.


==>STEP NUM: 4
==>ACT: drop yo-yo
==>OBSERVATION: Dropped.


==>STEP NUM: 5
==>ACT: drop key
==>OBSERVATION: Dropped.


==>STEP NUM: 6
==>ACT: east
==>OBSERVATION: Corridor
This corridor, like almost all the corridors of the TARDIS, seems to stretch on forever.  The console room lies to the west, and the corridor continues eastward into the distance.  There's a closed door on the south wall.


==>STEP NUM: 7
==>ACT: open door
==>OBSERVATION: You open the door.


==>STEP NUM: 8
==>ACT: south
==>OBSERVATION: Workshop
This is the room where you do much of your tinkering with electronic gadgetry.  Many a Rutan invasion or Dalek plot has been foiled by an ingenius invention you've thrown together at last minute in this room.  In fitting with your work habits, it's usually a rather untidy place.  However, in your latest fit of spring cleaning you've almost emptied the place out. There's a small cupboard on the eastern wall, and on the north wall an open door connects the workshop to the corridor outside.

Your workbench dominates the center of the room.

On the workbench is your toolkit (which is closed).


==>STEP NUM: 9
==>ACT: get toolkit
==>OBSERVATION: Taken.


==>STEP NUM: 10
==>ACT: open toolkit
==>OBSERVATION: Opening the toolkit reveals your sonic screwdriver and a homing device.


==>STEP NUM: 11
==>ACT: get screwdriver
==>OBSERVATION: Taken.


==>STEP NUM: 12
==>ACT: get homing
==>OBSERVATION: Taken.


==>STEP NUM: 13
==>ACT: examine homing
==>OBSERVATION: The homing device is a small gold polyhedron.  It is currently turned off.


==>STEP NUM: 14
==>ACT: turn on homing
==>OBSERVATION: When you switch on the homing device, a pulsating glow appears somewhere inside it.


==>STEP NUM: 15
==>ACT: open cupboard
==>OBSERVATION: Opening the cupboard reveals a small cloth pouch (which is closed).


==>STEP NUM: 16
==>ACT: get pouch
==>OBSERVATION: Taken.


==>STEP NUM: 17
==>ACT: open pouch
==>OBSERVATION: Opening the small cloth pouch reveals a gold card.


==>STEP NUM: 18
==>ACT: put pouch in toolkit
==>OBSERVATION: You put the small cloth pouch into the toolkit.


==>STEP NUM: 19
==>ACT: north
==>OBSERVATION: Corridor


==>STEP NUM: 20
==>ACT: west
==>OBSERVATION: Console Room

You can see the TARDIS key, your yo-yo and a tweed jacket here.


==>STEP NUM: 21
==>ACT: examine scanner
==>OBSERVATION: The scanner (which resembles an old television set) displays a picture of a barren rocky landscape.
